class CDRec(infected_matrix)¶

CDRec class to impute missing value with Centroid Decomposition.

impute(self, user_defined=True, params=None):

Launch the imputation of the CDREC

algorithm = 'cdrec'¶
impute(user_defined=True, params=None)¶

Imputation of data with CDREC algorithm.

Parameters:

  • user_defined (bool, optional) – Decide whether to launch the imputation with default/user_defined parameters or auto-ml. Default is True.

  • params (dict, optional) –

    Parameters of the algorithm or Auto-ML, if None, default ones are loaded.

    Option 1: Algorithm parameters

    • rankint

      Rank of reduction of the matrix (must be higher than 1 and smaller than the limit of series).

    • epsilonfloat

      Learning rate.

    • iterationsint

      Number of iterations.

    Option 2: AutoML parameters

    • ground_truthnumpy.ndarray

      Values of time series without contamination.

    • optimizerstr

      Optimizer to use, can be “bayesian”, “greedy”, “pso”, or “sh”.

    • optionsdict, optional

      Optional parameters for each optimizer.

      Bayesian:

      • n_callsint, optional

        Number of calls to the objective function. Default is 3.

      • selected_metricslist, optional

        List of selected metrics to consider for optimization. Default is [“RMSE”].

      • n_random_startsint, optional

        Number of initial calls to the objective function from random points. Default is 50.

      • acq_funcstr, optional

        Function to minimize over the Gaussian prior, one of ‘LCB’, ‘EI’, ‘PI’, or ‘gp_hedge’. Default is ‘gp_hedge’.

      Greedy:

      • n_callsint, optional

        Number of calls to the objective function. Default is 3.

      • selected_metricslist, optional

        List of selected metrics to consider for optimization. Default is [“RMSE”].

      PSO:

      • n_particlesint, optional

        Number of particles used.

      • c1float, optional

        PSO c1 parameter.

      • c2float, optional

        PSO c2 parameter.

      • wfloat, optional

        PSO w parameter.

      • iterationsint, optional

        Number of iterations for the optimization.

      • n_processesint, optional

        Number of processes during the optimization.

      SH:

      • num_configsint, optional

        Number of configurations to try.

      • num_iterationsint, optional

        Number of iterations to run the optimization.

      • reduction_factorint, optional

        Reduction factor for the number of configurations kept after each iteration.

Returns:

  • self (CDRec) – CDRec object with imputed_matrix set.

  • author: Quentin Nater

evaluate_params(contamination, configuration, algorithm='cdrec')¶

evaluate various statistics for given parameters. :author: Quentin Nater

Parameters:

  • ground_truth – original time series without contamination

  • contamination – time series with contamination

:param configuration : tuple of the configuration of the algorithm. :param algorithm : imputation algorithm to use | Valid values: ‘cdrec’, ‘mrnn’, ‘stmvl’, ‘iim’ | default = cdrec :param selected_metrics : list of selected metrics to compute | default = [“rmse”] :return: dict, a dictionary of computed statistics.

class Contaminate¶

Bases: object

blackout(missing_rate=0.2, protection=0.1)¶

Contamination of time series base on the blackout scenario :author: Quentin Nater

Parameters:

  • missing_rate – percentage of missing values by series | default 0.2

  • protection – size in the beginning of the time series where contamination is not proceeded | default 0.1

Returns:

the contaminated time series

mcar(series_impacted=0.2, missing_rate=0.2, block_size=10, protection=0.1, use_seed=True, seed=42, explainer=False)¶

Contamination of time series base on the Missing Completely at Random scenario :author: Quentin Nater

Parameters:

  • series_impacted – percentage of series contaminated | default 0.2

  • missing_rate – percentage of missing values by series | default 0.2

  • block_size – size of the block to remove at each random position selected | default 10

  • protection – size in the beginning of the time series where contamination is not proceeded | default 0.1

  • use_seed – use a seed to reproduce the test | default true

  • seed – value of the seed | default 42

:param explainer : use the MCAR on specific series to explain the imputation # default False :return: the contaminated time series

missing_percentage(series_impacted=0.2, missing_rate=0.2, protection=0.1)¶

Contamination of time series base on the missing percentage scenario :author: Quentin Nater

Parameters:

  • series_impacted – percentage of series contaminated | default 0.2

  • missing_rate – percentage of missing values by series | default 0.2

  • protection – size in the beginning of the time series where contamination is not proceeded | default 0.1

Returns:

the contaminated time series

plot(raw_data, infected_data=None, imputed_data=None, title='Time Series Data', max_series=None, max_values=None, size=(16, 8), save_path='', display=True)¶

Plot a chosen time series :author: Quentin Nater

Parameters:

  • raw_data – original time series without contamination

  • infected_data – time series with contamination

  • imputed_data – new time series with imputation values

  • title – title of the plot

:param max_series : limitation of the maximum number of series (computation limitation) | default None :param max_values : limitation of the maximum number of values by series (computation limitation) | default None :param size : size of the plots :param save_path : path to save locally the plot :param display : display or not the result

:return : filepath

class Bayesian¶

Bases: object

optimize(contamination, selected_metrics=['RMSE'], algorithm='cdrec', n_calls=100, n_random_starts=50, acq_func='gp_hedge')¶

Conduct the Bayesian optimization for hyperparameters.

:param : :type : param ground_truth : time series data set to optimize :param : :type : param contamination : time series contaminate to impute :param : :type : param selected_metrics : list of selected metrics to consider for optimization. | default [“RMSE”] :param : :type : param algorithm : imputation algorithm | Valid values: ‘cdrec’, ‘mrnn’, ‘stmvl’, ‘iim’ | default ‘cdrec’ :param : :type : param n_calls: bayesian parameters, number of calls to the objective function. :param : :type : param n_random_starts: bayesian parameters, number of initial calls to the objective function, from random points. :param : :type : param acq_func: bayesian parameters, function to minimize over the Gaussian prior (one of ‘LCB’, ‘EI’, ‘PI’, ‘gp_hedge’) | default gp_hedge :param : :type : return : Tuple[dict, Union[Union[int, float, complex], Any]], the best parameters and their corresponding scores, Cost of the optimization

Conduct the Greedy for hyperparameters.

Conduct the Particle swarm optimization for hyperparameters.

:param : :type : param ground_truth : time series data set to optimize :param : :type : param contamination : time series contaminate to impute :param : :type : param selected_metrics : list of selected metrics to consider for optimization. | default [“RMSE”] :param : :type : param algorithm : imputation algorithm | Valid values: ‘cdrec’, ‘mrnn’, ‘stmvl’, ‘iim’ | default ‘cdrec’ :param : :type : param n_particles: pso parameters, number of particles used :param : :type : param c1: pso parameters, c1 option value :param : :type : param c2: pso parameters, c2 option value :param : :type : param w: pso parameters, w option value :param : :type : param iterations: pso parameters, number of iterations for the optimization :param : :type : param n_processes: pso parameters, number of process during the optimization :param : :type : return : Tuple[dict, Union[Union[int, float, complex], Any]], the best parameters and their corresponding scores, Cost of the optimization

class SuccessiveHalving¶

Bases: object

optimize(ground_truth, contamination, selected_metrics, algorithm, num_configs, num_iterations, reduction_factor)¶

Conduct the Particle swarm optimization for hyperparameters.

:param : :type : param ground_truth : time series data set to optimize :param : :type : param contamination : time series contaminate to impute :param : :type : param selected_metrics : list of selected metrics to consider for optimization. | default [“RMSE”] :param : :type : param algorithm : imputation algorithm | Valid values: ‘cdrec’, ‘mrnn’, ‘stmvl’, ‘iim’ | default ‘cdrec’ :param : :type : param num_configs: sh parameters, number of configurations to try. :param : :type : param num_iterations: sh parameters, number of iterations to run the optimization. :param : :type : param reduction_factor: sh parameters, reduction factor for the number of configurations kept after each iteration.

:return : Tuple[dict, Union[Union[int, float, complex], Any]], the best parameters and their corresponding scores, Cost of the optimization

save_optimization(algorithm='cdrec', dataset='', optimizer='b', file_name=None)¶

Save the optimization parameters to a TOML file to use later without recomputing.

Parameters:

  • optimal_params – dictionary of the optimal parameters.

  • file_name – name of the TOML file to save the results. Default is ‘optimization_results.toml’.
